content:
What is the proper XML format to store information about a collection of books including their titles, authors, and publication dates? Can you provide an example of XML data that stores information about two books? 
[XML data]: 
<library>
  <book>
    <title>The Catcher in the Rye</title>
    <author>J.D. Salinger</author>
    <publicationDate>1951-07-16</publicationDate>
  </book>
  <book>
    <title>To Kill a Mockingbird</title>
    <author>Harper Lee</author>
    <publicationDate>1960-07-11</publicationDate>
  </book>
</library>

Certainly! The XML format you've provided is a good example of how to structure data for a collection of books. Each book's details are encapsulated within a `<book>` element, which includes child elements for the title, author, and publication date. These `<book>` elements are nested within a parent `<library>` element to represent the collection.

Here is the XML data you provided, formatted correctly:

```xml
<library>
  <book>
    <title>The Catcher in the Rye</title>
    <author>J.D. Salinger</author>
    <publicationDate>1951-07-16</publicationDate>
  </book>
  <book>
    <title>To Kill a Mockingbird</title>
    <author>Harper Lee</author>
    <publicationDate>1960-07-11</publicationDate>
  </book>
</library>
```

This XML structure is well-formed and clearly organizes the information for each book, making it easy to parse and understand. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
